subject: Golf
lead_paragraph: A whirlwind month is almost over for the 18-year-old New Zealander Danny Lee. First, he became the sixth player in the 106-year history of the Western Amateur to sweep medalist and match-play honors. Then came a tie for 20th in his PGA Tour debut at the Wyndham Championship. Now, he is a favorite in the United States Amateur at Pinehurst, N.C., where he shot a one-over 71 in the opening round Monday.
